description: {"blocks":[{"key":"9jgo","text":"The protocols here described are related to the sections presented in Figure 1A (open boxes) focusing on the activity performed in preparing the biological material to be used by the students during the practical laboratory lessons. All the steps are presented and critically commented when deemed useful. The reagents used during the preparation of these protocols are indicated as an example, as all the reagents can be purchased from any company.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

fork_info.title: S1 File  The Protocols for preparing the laboratory practical lessons

journal.name: PLOS One
journal.citation: Gasparello J, Papi C, Zurlo M, Cosenza LC, Breveglieri G, et al. (2022) Teaching during COVID-19 pandemic in practical laboratory classes of applied biochemistry and pharmacology: A validated fast and simple protocol for detection of SARS-CoV-2 Spike sequences. PLOS ONE 17(4): e0266419. https://doi.org/10.1371/journal.pone.0266419

steps.section: S1 File The Protocols for preparing the laboratory practical lessons
steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"csrnb","text":"A549 cell culture and transfection with pCMV3-Spike-GFPSpark plasmid","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

steps.section: S1 File The Protocols for preparing the laboratory practical lessons
steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"dlrj0","text":"RNA extraction. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

steps.section: S1 File The Protocols for preparing the laboratory practical lessons
steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"d4gu9","text":"A549 cell culture and transfection with pCMV3-Spike-GFPSpark plasmid","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

steps.section: S1 File The Protocols for preparing the laboratory practical lessons
steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"efcnn","text":"Thaw bacteria (E.coli JM109 strain) on ice for about ten minutes (use about 100 µl aliquots); ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"italic","offset":15,"length":6}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

steps.section: S1 File The Protocols for preparing the laboratory practical lessons
steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"79jp1","text":"Mix bacteria by finger vortexing and add 10 ng of pCMV-C-GFPSpark by slowly pipetting (no more than twice);","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

steps.section: S1 File The Protocols for preparing the laboratory practical lessons
steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"2pd3t","text":"Incubate on ice for 30 min and then at 42°C for 1 min","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

steps.section: S1 File The Protocols for preparing the laboratory practical lessons
steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"f1j23","text":"Put on ice for 2 min","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

steps.section: S1 File The Protocols for preparing the laboratory practical lessons
steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"854nd","text":"Add 200 µl of LB (Luria-Bertani)-medium (Triptone; Yeast Extract; NaCl) without antibiotic","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

steps.section: S1 File The Protocols for preparing the laboratory practical lessons
steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"d9iao","text":"Incubate at 37°C for 1 hour, keeping in slow shaking (about 90 rpm);","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

steps.section: S1 File The Protocols for preparing the laboratory practical lessons
steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"a3s2t","text":"Incubate at 37°C for 1 hour, keeping in slow shaking (about 90 rpm);","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

steps.section: S1 File The Protocols for preparing the laboratory practical lessons
steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"ell7t","text":"The day after pick a colony and grow bacteria carrying the pCMV-GFP plasmid in 100 ml of LB-medium (Luria Bertani medium) with antibiotic (Kanamycin, final concentration 25 µg/ml) at 37°C under shaking until the desired density is reached","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

steps.section: S1 File The Protocols for preparing the laboratory practical lessons
steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"a3b4e","text":"Take about 50 ml of culture medium containing bacteria grown up to the plateau (turbid medium); centrifuge at 3,000 rpm for 30 min at 4°C; remove the supernatant by inverting the 50 ml tube","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

steps.section: S1 File The Protocols for preparing the laboratory practical lessons
steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"6kjfg","text":"Resuspend the pellet in 5 ml of buffer P1 added with 100 µg/ml RNase A and Lyse Blue solution","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

steps.section: S1 File The Protocols for preparing the laboratory practical lessons
steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"lgfu","text":"Add 4 ml of buffer P2, shake by inversion for 4 times, until the solution became blue or light blue, incubate 5 min at RT","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

steps.section: S1 File The Protocols for preparing the laboratory practical lessons
steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"c1t9r","text":"Add 5 ml of buffer P3, shake by inversion 4 times (comment: white precipitated particles will form) incubate on ice for 15 min","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

steps.section: S1 File The Protocols for preparing the laboratory practical lessons
steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"231nm","text":"Centrifuge for 30 min at 4°C, 3,000 rpm; take the supernatant (containing the plasmid DNA)","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

steps.section: S1 File The Protocols for preparing the laboratory practical lessons
steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"cjc93","text":"Equilibrate a QIAGEN-tip adding 4 ml of QBT buffer, allow column to become empty by gravity flow, then add the supernatant and allow it to enter the resin by gravity flow","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

steps.section: S1 File The Protocols for preparing the laboratory practical lessons
steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"cj6m9","text":"Wash the column 2 times with 10 ml of QC Buffer, allowing the buffer to move through the QIAGEN-tip by gravity flow","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

steps.section: S1 File The Protocols for preparing the laboratory practical lessons
steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"66jd6","text":"Elute the plasmid with 5 ml of QF buffer into a clean tube","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

steps.section: S1 File The Protocols for preparing the laboratory practical lessons
steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"4o54l","text":"Elute the plasmid with 5 ml of QF buffer into a clean tube","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

steps.section: S1 File The Protocols for preparing the laboratory practical lessons
steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"3fusj","text":"Centrifuge 1.5 ml tubes at 12,000 rpm for 30 min at 4°C, discard the supernatant by inverting 1.5 ml tubes and dry tubes using a lab paper","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

steps.section: S1 File The Protocols for preparing the laboratory practical lessons
steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"39a9t","text":"Add 400 µl of 75% EtOH to each tube and centrifuge at 12,000 rpm 4°C for 10 minutes","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

steps.section: S1 File The Protocols for preparing the laboratory practical lessons
steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"2ei5f","text":"Remove the ethanol and allow the pellets to dry in the air, under the hood","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

steps.section: S1 File The Protocols for preparing the laboratory practical lessons
steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"cf8jh","text":"Resuspend the plasmid DNA pellet in TE (Tris-EDTA pH = 8) ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

steps.section: S1 File The Protocols for preparing the laboratory practical lessons
steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"83eaq","text":"Detach A549 cells, when are at confluence, from a starting T25 flask. Briefly: remove cell supernatant, wash the cells once with 5 ml of DPBS, add 1 ml of trypsin-EDTA and incubate at 37°C for 5 min. Add 1 ml of FBS to inactivate trypsin action and add 8 ml of DMEM to restore the starting volume","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

steps.section: S1 File The Protocols for preparing the laboratory practical lessons
steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"1bvud","text":"Plate A549 cells in a 12-well plate at 35-40% confluence one day before the transfection using DMEM + FBS 10% as medium","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

steps.section: S1 File The Protocols for preparing the laboratory practical lessons
steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"9na52","text":"Incubate cells for 24 hours at 37°C, 5% CO2","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"sub","offset":42,"length":1}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

steps.section: S1 File The Protocols for preparing the laboratory practical lessons
steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"9mfe9","text":"The day after, remove the old medium, and replace it with 1 ml of new medium composed by DMEM + FBS 10%. The procedure should be performed at least 30 min before the transfection. At the day of the transfection cells must be at 70-80% of confluence;","type":"align-justify","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"9gfvk","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

steps.section: S1 File The Protocols for preparing the laboratory practical lessons
steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"jk2b","text":"Prepare a mixture containing 1 µg of pCMV3-Spike-GFPSpark plasmid, 1 µl of PLUS Reagent and 47.5 µl of opti-MEM. Incubate the mixture at RT for 5 min","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

steps.section: S1 File The Protocols for preparing the laboratory practical lessons
steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"6htuc","text":"Add 2.5 µl of Lipofectamine LTX to the mixture and incubate at room temperature for 30 min","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

steps.section: S1 File The Protocols for preparing the laboratory practical lessons
steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"5teno","text":"Add 2.5 µl of Lipofectamine LTX to the mixture and incubate at room temperature for 30 min","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

steps.section: S1 File The Protocols for preparing the laboratory practical lessons
steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"5ba1m","text":"Stir the plate and incubate at 37°C, 5% CO2for 24 hours","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"sub","offset":42,"length":1}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

steps.section: S1 File The Protocols for preparing the laboratory practical lessons
steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"1q8gj","text":"The day after observe cells at fluorescence microscope using FITC filter (Excitation 490, Emission 525);","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

steps.section: S1 File The Protocols for preparing the laboratory practical lessons
steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"d348l","text":"Remove the supernatant, wash the well with 1 ml of DPBS, add 200 µl of trypsin and incubate at 37°C for 5 min, add the same volume (200 µl) of FBS, restore the starting well-volume with 600 µl of DMEM","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

steps.section: S1 File The Protocols for preparing the laboratory practical lessons
steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"6cqmp","text":"Centrifuge detached cells at 1,200 rpm for 8 min RT","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

steps.section: S1 File The Protocols for preparing the laboratory practical lessons
steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"dk042","text":"Centrifuge detached cells at 1,200 rpm for 8 min RT","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

steps.section: S1 File The Protocols for preparing the laboratory practical lessons
steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"eq48j","text":"Centrifuge again as indicated at point “k”","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

steps.section: S1 File The Protocols for preparing the laboratory practical lessons
steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"9qhed","text":"Remove the supernatant and resuspend the pellet by adding 300 µl of DPBS","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

steps.section: S1 File The Protocols for preparing the laboratory practical lessons
steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"9a2um","text":"Remove the supernatant and resuspend the pellet by adding 300 µl of DPBS","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

steps.section: S1 File The Protocols for preparing the laboratory practical lessons
steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"8euh4","text":"Detach cells adding 200 µl of trypsin to each well, incubate for 5 min at 37°C, add the same volume of FBS to inactivate trypsin and restore the starting well volume with 600 µl of DMEM","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

steps.section: S1 File The Protocols for preparing the laboratory practical lessons
steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"9cpv3","text":"Collect cells and centrifuge at 1,200 rpm for 8 min at RT","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

steps.section: S1 File The Protocols for preparing the laboratory practical lessons
steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"7n6vt","text":"Remove supernatant and wash the cellular pellet with DPBS","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

steps.section: S1 File The Protocols for preparing the laboratory practical lessons
steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"d611","text":"Lyse cellular pellets adding 900 μl of TRI Reagent under a chemical hood: immediately after addition, pipette quickly to make the system homogeneous (comment: no white fragments of the pellet should be present)","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

steps.section: S1 File The Protocols for preparing the laboratory practical lessons
steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"p4m3","text":"Incubate the samples for 5 min at room temperature (RT), keeping them in the rack","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

steps.section: S1 File The Protocols for preparing the laboratory practical lessons
steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"64psi","text":"Add 200 µl of RNase-free chloroform, under a chemical hood. (Comment: chloroform is very volatile and tends to drip; to avoid this, prime the tip before taking the chloroform);","type":"align-justify","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"7af12","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

steps.section: S1 File The Protocols for preparing the laboratory practical lessons
steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"e2t6g","text":"Mix vigorously by inversion for 15 sec, until the solution becomes homogeneous and the two phases can no longer be distinguished","type":"align-justify","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

steps.section: S1 File The Protocols for preparing the laboratory practical lessons
steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"bblsl","text":"Incubate the samples at RT for 2-3 min, keeping them in the rack","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

steps.section: S1 File The Protocols for preparing the laboratory practical lessons
steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"cpm8f","text":"Centrifuge at 12,000 rpm, for 15 min, at 4 ° C. The mixture separates into 3 phases:","type":"align-justify","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"4dajf","text":"-Upper aqueous phase: transparent, contains RNA","type":"align-justify","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"1tepe","text":"-Whitish semi-solid interface: contains DNA and proteins","type":"align-justify","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"l6pa","text":"-Lower organic phase: pink, contains DNA, proteins and lipids","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

steps.section: S1 File The Protocols for preparing the laboratory practical lessons
steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"96tn8","text":"Take the upper aqueous phase without touching or drawing the interface or the pink organic phase, and transfer it into a new 1.5 ml RNase-free tube: work under a chemical hood","type":"align-justify","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

steps.section: S1 File The Protocols for preparing the laboratory practical lessons
steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"5tmf9","text":"Add 500 µl of 100% RNase-free isopropanol to precipitate the RNA and mix well by inverting the 1.5 ml tube. (Comment: Isopropanol is very volatile and can drip, to avoid this, prime the tip before taking the isopropanol);","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

steps.section: S1 File The Protocols for preparing the laboratory practical lessons
steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"56fmt","text":"Incubate the samples at RT for 10 min","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

steps.section: S1 File The Protocols for preparing the laboratory practical lessons
steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"7d75","text":"Centrifuge at 12,000 rpm, for 15 min, at 4°C. A pellet containing the RNA will be obtained","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

steps.section: S1 File The Protocols for preparing the laboratory practical lessons
steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"c9lmk","text":"Discard the supernatant with the pipette","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

steps.section: S1 File The Protocols for preparing the laboratory practical lessons
steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"5v9du","text":"Add 900 µl of 75% RNase-free ethanol, pre-cooled on ice, (Comment: the ethanol is very volatile and can drip, to avoid this, prime the tip before taking the solution)","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

steps.section: S1 File The Protocols for preparing the laboratory practical lessons
steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"14h9u","text":"Gently invert the 1.5 ml tubes to wash the pellets. Observe carefully the size of the pellet obtained, this is essential to establish the volume of water to be used to resuspend the pellet","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

steps.section: S1 File The Protocols for preparing the laboratory practical lessons
steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"apgo9","text":"Centrifuge at 12,000 rpm, for 5 min, at 4°C","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

steps.section: S1 File The Protocols for preparing the laboratory practical lessons
steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"cerei","text":"Discard the supernatant with the pipette","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

steps.section: S1 File The Protocols for preparing the laboratory practical lessons
steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"417q0","text":"Allow the RNA pellets to dry in the air under the hood for about 10 min","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

steps.section: S1 File The Protocols for preparing the laboratory practical lessons
steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"9tq0d","text":"Resuspend the RNA in 20 µl or more of RNase-free H2O, pipetting several times (Comment: the volume of water to be added may vary based on the size of the pellet and will be established after careful observation of the pellet)","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"sub","offset":50,"length":1}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

steps.section: S1 File The Protocols for preparing the laboratory practical lessons
steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"1b2mr","text":"Store on ice, if analyzed immediately, or freeze at -80°C ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}
